author: David Poulin
title: iGIVit - The Future of Giving
description: Giving to charities should be a transparent process, with the general public empowered to see exactly how their donations are used

assessments.note: One of the most mature proposals what I've seen till now. I like that the proposers didn't gave up on their idea, followed up and reworked it. The proposal has a big potential and it addresses the problem very precisely. From scalability point of view it also holds a lot of potential for further expansions.

Using Cardano to generate thrust is a good principle in general and applying this goal to charity donations makes sense. The definition of the problem is supported by a thorough study from give.org. Charities using this app could bring new users to Cardano and bring visibility through a real-world application. The proposer evaluates the existing targeted market at several hundred billion USD. It is also claimed that new users could involve in a donation process thanks to the thrust added by this app.

This project will definetely provide a lot of purpose to a lot of people if implemented. The proposal is very well-written, explains exactly the purpose, the functions and the obstacles and is very detailed and transparent. Kudos!

The proposal itself will not jet use a blockchain, but only it is the first step toward the final product iGIVit. This product should/will provide improved transparency for donations  with the help of the Cardano Blockchain. What a wonderful combination.

This dApp is a very good idea and a very good use case for blockchain, and can potentially bring a lot of good advertisement to Cardano itself. The benefits, as well as challenges an everything in between is mapped. Also, it is one of the best written proposals I've seen so far. Well structured, clear, video, audio, slides, short and long versions, and all the information is there. This could be used as a model in a future 'proposer course'. Flawless!

This is exactly the type of idea that I feel meets community expectations. The team have arrived at an excellent application that addresses a societal issue. The proposal may grow in terms of application with further refinement but at this stage appears a well thought out starting point.

The proposers have reliable experience and the budget brake down and milestones are also realistic. As risk I see an acceptance / open attitude from the charity organisations. They usually impacted by some government and higher circles, thus it might be hard to assign any of them. Beside in some cases the people who make donations wants to stay anonymous , that part is also lost, shall be calculated with it.

The proposers expect to outsource the technical component, but don't have a clear plan on what is actually being done. How will they track what is done with the donations? Where does that data come from. Who is auditing it? How do they link up with charities and embed in their systems? How do they link up with donors?
assessments.reply: I believe most of those points are adressed within our proposal. We are outsourcing the development but we are quite well aware on how we intend to implement our solution and deal with all the points underlined by the CA.

assessments.note: As said in previous comment, the problem is well defined and it is a direct application of blockchain. The different aspects of the project are well documented, targeted market, opportunities, marketing strategy. Risks have been listed and mitigated. It makes me feel it is a very well thought out project. The two proposers have skills in project management and computer science. One of them is following the Plutus pioneer program which shows a determination for developing skills on Cardano. A partnership with an identified charity for the initial launch would have made me give the 5 stars.

The proposal is very well planned and the proposers are experienced in managing projects, which is also reflected in the plan. Some work and research already has been done, which shows the commitment . Assuming they can onboard a developer, which should be well possible with the proposed budget, it is very likely that the plan will be implemented successfully
A qualified teams is provided with links to the linkedin-profiles. The profiles on linkedin are convincing. Also the proposal has so many details that all fit well together.

Both the proposed MVP and the final product seems to be feasible due to the team's experience and engagement. Also, all the relevant information about the proposers in linked there which is very good. The plan in clear, structured and each step is well described. Budget breakdown in the proposal is very good, and the details in the linked file are very well described. Proposal seems to be completely feasible based all the information provided.

The team appear to have the necessary skills to bring this project to fruition and the links provided helped to further this appearance. The plan is well presented and achievable. Budget is straightforward and not excessive and this gives confidence that the proposal if funded is likely to move forward. The team have done well to highlight the risks and the community questions are answered appropriately.
The achievement steps are realistic. Front loading would be advantageous, interview and find organisations who would join, this part could be one of the key points.
assessments.reply: I feel the comment is describing good points but the rating aims at a lower figure. But I might be wrong and 3 is maybe the correct score for this.

assessments.note: The proposer has a detailed roadmap, and he states is already proceeding hiring the external developers for coding the app. The first campaign is expected in October 21.  The budget breakdown also gives a good level of auditability to the project.
The proposal is very well structured, has a dedicated plan, clear milestones with obtainable sub-tasks and a realistic budget. It will be possible to audit it all the way to product.
detailed roadmap, measurement of succes, budget is provided. especially the detailed budget makes auditing review of success very easy.

The roadmap and milestones are very well described, each step and its related cost are clear. Challenges are very well explained and discussed. The only thing missing are KPIs or key metrics to measure and quantify the success of this proposal. Some suggestions: number of partnerships with campaigns, number of users, volume and total amount of donations, etc.

Overall a really sound proposal that has aced the concept of marrying blockchain technology to a use case that the community will value. The potential of this proposal is high and it resonates well with Cardano values. I feel this proposal will be well received by the community and makes for an excellent example of the type of projects that will provide value adding to the community.

solution: With iGIVit, it will be easy to give and to keep track of all donations
experience: Our team is a combination of an experienced Data Engineer/PM/Plutus Pioneer and a visionary individual imagining how to improve philanthropy
